gpflowr
  • Reference

gpflowr

gpflowr (jee-pee-flower) is an R port of the GPflow python package for fitting Gaussian process models using Google’s TensorFlow library. The aim is to make this a pretty close translation of the python code, so it uses R6 classes for object-oriented design, with some tweaks and hacks to mimic python behaviour and functionality.

R doesn’t have an equivalent to GPflow’s readthedocs site, so the package documentation is hosted here (with a little help from pkgdown)

The package is currently only in the very early stages of development, so watch this space!

Links

  • Browse source code at https://github.com/goldingn/gpflowr
  • Report a bug at https://github.com/goldingn/gpflowr/issues
